<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and rail cars to deliver the Company&#x2019;s products to its customers and solid fuels to its plants on a timely basis; (vi)&nbsp;unanticipated delays, technical feasibility issues or cost overruns in completing modernization and expansion and development projects; (vii)&nbsp;the Company&#x2019;s ability to expand its Lime and Limestone Operations through acquisitions of businesses with related or similar operations, including obtaining financing for such acquisitions, and to successfully integrate acquired operations and sell any resulting increased production at acceptable prices; (viii)&nbsp;inadequate demand and/or prices for the Company&#x2019;s lime and limestone products due to conditions in the U.S. economy, recessionary pressures in particular industries, including construction, steel, industrial and oil and gas services, reduced demand from utility plants, increased competition from competitors, effects of governmental fiscal and budgetary constraints, including the level of highway construction funding, and legislative impasses, and inability to continue to increase or maintain prices for the Company&#x2019;s products; (ix)&nbsp;uncertainties of prices and regulations with respect to the Company&#x2019;s Natural Gas Interests, including the absence of drilling activities on the Company&#x2019;s O&nbsp;&amp; G Properties, inability to explore for new reserves, unitization of existing wells, declines in production rates and plugging and abandoning of existing wells; (x)&nbsp;ongoing and possible new regulations, investigations, enforcement actions and costs, legal expenses, penalties, fines, assessments, litigation, judgments and settlements, taxes and disruptions and limitations of operations, including those related to climate change and health and safety and those that could impact the Company&#x2019;s ability to continue or renew its operating permits or successfully secure new permits in connection with its modernization and expansion and development projects; and (xi)&nbsp;other risks and uncertainties set forth in this Report or indicated from time to time in the Company&#x2019;s filings with the SEC, including the Company&#x2019;s Quarterly Reports on Form&nbsp;10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Q.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	OVERVIEW.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	General.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have identified two business segments based on the distinctness of their activities and products: Lime and Limestone Operations and Natural Gas Interests. All operations are in the United States. In evaluating the operating results of our segments, management primarily reviews revenues and gross profit. We do not allocate corporate overhead or interest costs to our business segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Lime and Limestone Operations represent our principal business. Our Natural Gas Interests consist of royalty and non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;operating working interests under the O&nbsp;&amp; G Lease and the Drillsite Agreement with two separate operators related to our Johnson County, Texas property, located in the Barnett Shale Formation, on which Texas Lime conducts its lime and limestone operations. Our principal management decisions related to our Natural Gas Interests involve whether to participate as a non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;operating working interest owner by contributing our proportional costs for drilling proposed wells or workovers of existing wells under the O&nbsp;&amp; G Lease and the Drillsite Agreement. While we intend to continue to participate in future natural gas wells drilled and workovers of existing wells on our O&nbsp;&amp; G Properties, if any, we are not in the business of drilling for or producing natural gas, and have no personnel expert in that field.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues from our Lime and Limestone Operations decreased 11.2% in 2015 compared to 2014. The decreased sales volumes of our lime and limestone products, which accounted for a revenue decrease of approximately 12.4% for 2015 compared to 2014, resulted principally from decreased sales volumes to our oil and gas services, steel and industrial customers.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, revenues in 2014 included sales to another lime producer for delivery to its customers, which sales did not recur in 2015. Although our sales volumes to our construction customers in 2015 were basically flat compared to 2014, demand from our construction customers in the first half 2015 was substantially lower due to unusually persistent adverse weather conditions, including ice and snow storms in the first quarter, and, in our construction market areas, rainfall in the second quarter was among the highest in more than 100 years. The decrease in sales volumes was partially offset by an increase in average product prices for our lime and limestone products of approximately 1.2% in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues from our Natural Gas Interests decreased 53.6% in 2015 from compared to 2014 due to decreased average prices for natural gas and natural gas liquids, as well as decreased production volumes resulting from the normal declines in production rates on the Company&#x2019;s existing natural gas wells. The decrease in revenues from our Natural Gas Interests in 2015 resulted from price decreases of approximately 45.8% and decreases in production volumes of approximately 7.8%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	21
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gross profit decreased 22.0% in 2015 compared to 2014. Gross profit from our Lime and Limestone Operations in 2015 decreased 16.4% compared to 2014, primarily due to the decreased revenues discussed above, partially offset by lower energy costs as well as less discretionary outside contractor stripping costs. Gross profit from our Natural Gas Interests decreased 88.9% in 2015 compared to 2014, primarily due to the decreased revenues discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Interest expense decreased $0.5 million, or 32.2%, in 2015 compared to 2014, primarily as a result of our repayment of the $15.4 million then-outstanding balance of our term loans in the second quarter 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with such repayment, we repurchased our interest rate hedges associated with the term loans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:6PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:31.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 31.5PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the second quarter 2015, we also terminated the Corson Pension Plan (the &#x201C;Corson Plan&#x201D;), which required a cash payment of $0.2 million and resulted in a second quarter expense of $0.9 million ($0.6 million, net of tax benefit), included in other expense (income), net for 2015 that was previously included in accumulated other comprehensive loss.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the termination of the Corson Plan, the Company will not have to make any future contributions to the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:8PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:31.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The decrease in gross profit and the cost to terminate the Corson Plan were the primary reasons for a $6.5&nbsp;million, or 33.5%, decrease in our net income in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Even with the decrease in net income, cash flows from operations during 2015 enabled us to repay our $16.7 million in term loans, make $11.5&nbsp;million of capital investments, pay $2.8&nbsp;million in dividends, and terminate the Corson Plan, and left us with cash balances of $59.9&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2015, compared to $58.3&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:8PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:31.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On May 7, 2015, we amended our credit agreement to, among other things, provide for a $75 million revolving credit facility, maturing on May 7, 2020, and reduce our interest rate margins and commitment fees (the &#x201C;Amendment&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;The Amendment also provides for an incremental four-year accordion feature to borrow up to an additional $50 million on the same terms, subject to approval by the lender or another lender selected by us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 8PT;TEXT-INDENT:31.7PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In December 2015, we commenced a publicly announced share repurchase program to repurchase up to $10 million of our common stock.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to that program, we repurchased 3,086 shares in December at a weighted-average price of $54.79 per share.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2016, through March 3, 2016, we have repurchased 50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	068
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares at a weighted-average price of $5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2 per share.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;TEXT-INDENT:0PT;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;PADDING:0PT 36PT 0PT 0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Absent a significant acquisition opportunity arising during 2016, we anticipate funding our operating and capital needs, including possible modernization and expansion and development projects, paying cash dividends and repurchasing the remainder of our $10 million of share repurchase program from our cash on hand and cash flows from operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Lime and Limestone Operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In our Lime and Limestone Operations, we produce and sell PLS, quicklime, hydrated lime and lime slurry. The principal factors affecting our success are the level of demand and prices for our products and whether we are able to maintain sufficient production levels and product quality while controlling costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Inclement weather conditions, such as the winter ice and snow storms, cold weather and excessive rainfalls that we experienced in the first half 2015, generally reduce the demand for lime and limestone products supplied to construction
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;related customers that account for a significant amount of our revenues. Inclement weather also interferes with our open
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;pit mining operations and can disrupt our plant production. In addition to weather, various maintenance, environmental, accident and other operational issues can also disrupt our operations and increase our operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Demand for our products in our market areas is also affected by general economic conditions, the pace of construction, the demand for steel, level of oil and gas drilling in our markets, as well as the level of governmental and private funding for highway construction and utility plant usage of coal for power generation.&nbsp;&nbsp;Demand for our lime and limestone products from the construction industry was basically flat in 2015, although in the fourth quarter 2015 we saw construction demand increase, with such increase in demand carrying into 2016.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, demand for our lime and limestone products from our oil and gas services, steel and industrial customers declined during 2015. The decrease in oil and gas drilling activities in 2015, as a result of declining oil and natural gas prices, reduced demand from our oil and gas services customers, and decreased steel production resulted in lower demand from our steel customers. At the same time,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	22
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we also benefited from lower oil and gas prices, through lower transportation, freight and fuel costs during 2015, which somewhat offset the lower revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	resulting from reduced sales to our oil and gas services and steel customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 4, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the President signed into law the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Fixing America&#x2019;s Surface Transportation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Act (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	FAST Act
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;), the first multi
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year transportation authorization enacted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in over ten years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The FAST Act authorizes $305 billion over fiscal years 2016 through 2020 that provides long-term funding certainty for surface transportation projects.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Its enactment should allow states and local governments to move forward with critical transportation projects, like new highways, with confidence that the Highway Trust Fund will meet its obligations through 2020
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Also, in Texas, recently approved constitutional amendments authorized a portion of oil and gas tax revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	be deposited into the State Highway Fund and certain other sales and use tax revenues
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	be dedicated to the State Highway Fund.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;With these funding improvements, we expect to see continued increases in demand from our construction customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our modernization and expansion and development projects in Texas and Arkansas, including the construction of a third kiln in Arkansas (completed in December 2006), our development projects in Arkansas, our acquisitions of&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;U. S. Lime Company&#x2014;St.&nbsp;Clair and our Texas slurry operations, the December 2014 acquisition of the assets of a trucking company operation in Houston, Texas and the establishment of a new distribution terminal facility southwest of Houston, Texas, have positioned us to meet the demand for high
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;quality lime and limestone products in our markets. Our modernization and expansion and development projects have also equipped us with up
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;date, fuel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;efficient plant facilities, which has resulted in lower production costs and greater operating efficiencies, thus enhancing our competitive position. All of our kilns are fuel
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;efficient preheater kilns, except for one kiln at St.&nbsp;Clair.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For our plants to operate at peak efficiency, we must meet operational challenges that arise from time to time, including bringing new facilities on line and refurbishing and/or improving acquired facilities, such as St.&nbsp;Clair, which we acquired with the intention of modernizing and expanding, subject to permitting, technical feasibility, economics and market demand, as well as operating existing facilities efficiently. We also incur ongoing costs for maintenance and to remain in compliance with rapidly changing Environmental Laws and health and safety and other regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our primary variable cost is energy. Although we have seen reductions in our energy costs over the past year, prices for coal, petroleum coke, diesel, natural gas, electricity, transportation and freight are volatile and have generally increased over the past few years. In addition, our freight costs, including diesel prices, to deliver our products can be high relative to the value of our products and have generally increased in recent years, although diesel prices have decreased recently as oil prices have decreased. We have been able to mitigate to some degree the adverse impact of volatile energy costs by varying the mixes of fuel used in our kilns, and by passing on some of any increase in costs to our customers through higher prices and/or surcharges on certain products. We have not engaged in any significant hedging activity in an effort to control our energy costs, but may do so in the future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have financed our modernization and expansion and development projects and acquisitions through a combination of debt financing and cash flows from operations. We must generate sufficient cash flows to cover ongoing capital requirements, including possible modernization and expansion and development projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For us to maintain or increase our profitability in our Lime and Limestone Operations in the face of reduced demand from some of our customers, competitive pressures and increased costs, we must improve our revenues and control our operational and selling, general and administrative expenses. To maintain or improve our gross profit margins, we are focusing on maintaining, and increasing where possible, our lime and limestone prices to offset our increased costs, which is a challenging task in the current economic environment, with increased competition from other lime and limestone producers. In addition, we will continue to explore ways to increase the operating efficiency of our plants and other facilities, including the possible modernization of our St.&nbsp;Clair plant, and expand our production capacity through acquisitions as conditions warrant or opportunities arise.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We continue to believe the enhanced efficiency and production capacity resulting from our modernization and expansion and development projects at Texas and Arkansas, our acquisitions and the operational strategies we have implemented have allowed us to increase our efficiency, grow production capacity, improve product quality, better serve existing customers, attract new customers and control costs. To date, however, demand and prices for our lime and limestone products have not been sufficient to fully utilize our additional production capacity.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, there can be no assurance that our efficiency and production will not be adversely affected by weather, maintenance, accident or other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	23
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage26"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operational issues; that we can successfully invest in improvements to our existing facilities; that our results will not be adversely affected by increases in fuel, natural gas, electricity, transportation and freight costs or new environmental, health and safety or other regulatory requirements; or, that with increasing competition with other lime and limestone producers, our revenues, gross profit, net income and cash flows can be maintained or improved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Natural Gas Interests.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2004, we entered into the O&nbsp;&amp; G Lease with EOG with respect to oil and gas rights on our Cleburne, Texas property, located in the Barnett Shale Formation. Pursuant to the O&nbsp;&amp; G Lease, we have royalty interests ranging from 15.4% to 20% in oil and gas produced from any successful wells drilled on the leased property and an option to participate in any well drilled on the leased property as a 20% non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;operating working interest owner. Our overall average revenue interest is 34.7% in the 33 wells drilled under the O&nbsp;&amp; G Lease that are currently producing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In November 2006, we also entered into a Drillsite Agreement with XTO that has an oil and gas lease covering approximately 538 acres of land contiguous to our Johnson County, Texas property. Pursuant to this Agreement, we have a 3% royalty interest and an optional 12.5% non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;operating working interest, resulting in a 12.4% interest in revenues in the six XTO wells drilled and producing from a padsite located on our property.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	No new wells have been completed since 2011, and there are no present plans to drill additional wells on the O&amp;G Properties. We cannot predict the number of additional wells that ultimately will be drilled on the O&nbsp;&amp; G Properties, if any, or their results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The pricing of natural gas sales is primarily determined by supply and demand in the marketplace and can fluctuate considerably. The prices that the Company receives for its natural gas production is also affected by the amount of natural gas liquids included in the natural gas, and the prices for those liquids is also subject to supply and demand factors. Prices of both natural gas and natural gas liquids have declined drastically in recent years, principally due to increased supply.&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition, if estimates of our proved oil and gas reserves decline due to further declines in prices for natural gas and natural gas liquids or other reasons, the rate at which we record depletion expense would increase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	CRITICAL ACCOUNTING POLICIES.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations are based upon our consolidated financial statements, which have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (&#x201C;US&nbsp;GAAP&#x201D;). The preparation of these financial statements requires us to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses, and related disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities, at the date of our financial statements. Actual results may differ from these estimates and judgments under different assumptions or conditions and historical trends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Critical accounting policies are defined as those that are reflective of significant management judgments and uncertainties and potentially result in materially different results under different assumptions and conditions. We believe the following critical accounting policies require the most significant management estimates and judgments used in the preparation of our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Accounts receivable.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We estimate the collectability of our trade receivables. A considerable amount of judgment is required in assessing the ultimate realization of these receivables and determining our allowance for doubtful accounts. Uncollected trade receivables are charged
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;off when identified by management to be unrecoverable. The majority of our trade receivables are unsecured. Payment terms for our trade receivables are based on underlying purchase orders, contracts or purchase agreements. Credit losses relating to these receivables have generally been within management expectations and historical trends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Successful
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;efforts method for Natural Gas Interests.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We use the successful
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;efforts method to account for development expenditures related to our Natural Gas Interests. Under this method, drilling and completion costs of development wells are capitalized and depleted using the units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;production method. Costs to drill exploratory wells, if any, that do not find proved reserves are expensed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Reserve estimates.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Proved oil and gas reserves are those quantities of oil and gas, which, by analysis of geoscience and engineering data, can be estimated with reasonable certainty to be economically producible from a given date forward, from known reservoirs, and under existing economic conditions, operating methods, and government regulations, prior to the time at which contracts providing the right to operate expire, unless evidence indicates that renewal is reasonably certain, regardless of whether deterministic or probabilistic methods are used for the estimation. The project to extract the hydrocarbons must have commenced or the operator must be reasonably certain it will commence the project within a reasonable time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The volumes of our reserves are estimates that, by their nature, are subject to revision. The estimates are made using geological and reservoir data, as well as production performance data. These estimates will be reviewed annually and revised, either upward or downward, as warranted by additional performance data. If the estimates of proved reserves were to decline, the rate at which we record depletion expense would increase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Environmental costs and liabilities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We record environmental accruals in other liabilities, based on studies and estimates, when it is probable we have incurred a reasonably estimable cost or liability. The accruals are adjusted when further information warrants an adjustment. Environmental expenditures that extend the life, increase the capacity or improve the safety or efficiency of Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;owned assets or are incurred to mitigate or prevent future possible environmental issues are capitalized. Other environmental costs are expensed when incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contingencies.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We are party to proceedings, lawsuits and claims arising in the normal course of business relating to regulatory, labor, product and other matters. We are required to estimate the likelihood of any adverse judgments or outcomes with respect to these matters, as well as potential ranges of possible losses. A determination of the amount of reserves required, if any, for these contingencies is made after careful analysis of each individual matter, including coverage under our insurance policies. This determination may change in the future because of new information or developments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Derivatives.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Prior to repurchasing our interest rate hedges, we recorded their fair value on our Consolidated Balance Sheets and included any changes in fair value in comprehensive income. We determined fair value utilizing the cash flows valuation technique.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;based compensation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We expense all stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based payments to employees and directors, including grants of stock options and restricted stock, in our Consolidated Statements of Income based on their fair values. Compensation cost is recognized ratably over the vesting period for all stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.20%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</DIV>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.20%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</DIV>
	0.0
</TD>

	%&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:08.20%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PT DOUBLE #000000 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.78%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.26%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

	&nbsp;

</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2015 vs. 2014
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues for 2015 decreased to $130.8&nbsp;million from $149.8&nbsp;million in 2014, a decrease of $19.0&nbsp;million, or 12.7%. Revenues from our Lime and Limestone Operations for 2015 decreased $16.2&nbsp;million, or 11.2%, to $128.4&nbsp;million from $144.6&nbsp;million in 2014. The decrease in revenues from our Lime and Limestone Operations was primarily due to decreased sales volumes of our lime and limestone products, principally to our oil and gas services, steel and industrial customers, partially offset by increased sales volumes to our construction customers and a slight increase in prices realized for our lime and limestone products in 2015, compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues from our Natural Gas Interests for 2015 decreased $2.8&nbsp;million, or 53.6%, to $2.4&nbsp;million from $5.3&nbsp;million in 2014. The decrease in revenues from our Natural Gas Interests resulted from lower prices and the normal declines in production rates on existing wells.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gross profit decreased to $28.7&nbsp;million for 2015 from $36.8&nbsp;million for 2014, a decrease of $8.1&nbsp;million, or 22.0%. Gross profit from our Lime and Limestone Operations for 2015 was $28.4&nbsp;million, compared to $34.0&nbsp;million in 2014, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	decrease of $5.6&nbsp;million, or 16.4%. The decrease in gross profit fr
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	om
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our Lime and Limestone Operations in 2015 compared to 2014 resulted primarily from the decreased revenues discussed above, partially offset by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	lower
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	energy and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	discretionary outside contractor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	stripping costs in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gross profit for 2015 also included $0.3&nbsp;million from our Natural Gas Interests, compared to $2.8&nbsp;million in 2014, a decrease of $2.5&nbsp;million, or 88.9%. The decrease in gross profit from our Natural Gas Interests resulted primarily from the decreased revenue discussed above.&nbsp;&nbsp;Production volumes for 2015 from our Natural Gas Interests totaled 0.7 BCF, sold at an average price per MCF of $3.41, compared to 2014 when 0.8 BCF was produced and sold at an average price of $6.28 per MCF.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Selling general and administrative expenses (&#x201C;SG&amp;A&#x201D;) increased to $9.6&nbsp;million for 2015 from $9.5 million in 2014, an increase of $0.2&nbsp;million, or 1.7%. The increase in SG&amp;A was primarily due to an increase of $0.1 million in non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cash stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation costs which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was primarily due to increases in the price per share of the Company&#x2019;s common stock grant dates in 2014 and the first half 2015, compared to the prices per share on previous grant dates.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	26
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	percentage of revenues, SG&amp;A increased to 7.4% in 2015 from 6.4% in 2014, primarily due to the decrease in revenues for 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Interest expense for 2015 decreased to $1.0&nbsp;million from $1.5&nbsp;million in 2014, a decrease of $0.5&nbsp;million, or 32.2%. Interest expense in 2015 included $0.2&nbsp;million paid in quarterly settlement payments pursuant to our interest rate hedges, compared to $0.9&nbsp;million paid in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense for 2015 also included $0.5 million payment to repurchase our interest rate hedges in the second quarter 2015 in conjunction with the repayment of the then-outstanding balance on our term loans.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease in interest expense in 2015 primarily resulted from the repayment of our debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Other expense (income), net was an expense of $0.6 million in 2015, compared to income of $0.1 million in 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The net change of $0.8 million expense primarily resulted from the $0.9 million expense in 2015 for the termination of the Corson Plan discussed above, compared to an expense of $0.1 million for the Corson Plan in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Income tax expense decreased to $4.6&nbsp;million for 2015 from $6.6&nbsp;million in 2014, a decrease of $2.0&nbsp;million, or 29.9%. The decrease in income tax expense in 2015 compared to 2014 was primarily due to the decrease in our income before taxes. Our effective income tax rate for 2015 increased to 26.2%, compared to our 2014 rate of 25.3%, primarily due to an increase in state income taxes, net of federal income tax benefits, as a result of the full realization of the Company&#x2019;s net operating loss carryforwards in one state.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Net income decreased by $6.5&nbsp;million, or 33.5%, to $12.9&nbsp;million ($2.30 per share diluted), compared to net income of $19.4&nbsp;million ($3.47 per share diluted) in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	2014 vs. 2013
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues for 2014 increased to $149.8&nbsp;million from $133.8&nbsp;million in 2013, an increase of $16.1&nbsp;million, or 12.0%. Revenues from our Lime and Limestone Operations increased $16.6&nbsp;million, or 12.9%, to $144.6&nbsp;million from $128.0&nbsp;million in 2013. The increase in revenues from our Lime and Limestone Operations was primarily due to increased sales volumes of our lime and limestone products, principally to our construction, industrial, oil and gas services and environmental customers, and sales to another lime producer for delivery to its customers, partially offset by decreased sales volumes to our steel customers. In addition, we realized a slight increase in prices for our lime and limestone products in 2014, compared to 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenues from our Natural Gas Interests for 2014 decreased $0.5&nbsp;million, or 8.5%, to $5.3&nbsp;million from $5.8&nbsp;million in the prior year. The decrease in revenues from our Natural Gas Interests resulted from the normal declines in production rates on existing wells, partially offset by slightly higher prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our gross profit increased to $36.8&nbsp;million for 2014 from $30.8&nbsp;million for 2013, an increase of $6.0&nbsp;million, or 19.5%. Gross profit from our Lime and Limestone Operations for 2014 was $34.0&nbsp;million, compared to $27.9&nbsp;million in 2013, an increase of $6.0&nbsp;million, or 21.7%. The increase in gross profit in 2014 compared to 2013 resulted primarily from the increased revenues discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gross profit for 2014 also included $2.8&nbsp;million from our Natural Gas Interests, compared to $2.9&nbsp;million in 2013, a decrease of $0.1&nbsp;million or 1.9%. Production volumes for 2014 from our Natural Gas Interests totaled 0.8 BCF, sold at an average price per MCF of $6.28, compared to 2013 when 1.0&nbsp;BCF was produced and sold at an average price of $5.86 per MCF.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	SG&amp;A increased to $9.5&nbsp;million in 2014 from $9.2&nbsp;million in 2013, an increase of $0.3&nbsp;million, or 3.5%. As a percentage of revenues, SG&amp;A decreased to 6.4% in 2014 from 6.8% in 2013 due to the increase in revenues in 2014. The increase in SG&amp;A in 2014 compared to 2013 included increases in credit card fees, which increased approximately $0.2&nbsp;million, and in non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cash stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation costs, which also increased approximately $0.2&nbsp;million. The increase in credit card fees resulted primarily from more of the Company&#x2019;s customers making payments by credit card, while the increase in stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation costs was primarily due to increases in the price per share of the Company&#x2019;s common stock in 2013 and first half 2014, compared to the prices per share on previous grant dates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Interest expense in 2014 decreased to $1.5&nbsp;million from $1.9&nbsp;million in 2013, a decrease of $0.3&nbsp;million, or 17.4%. Interest expense in 2014 and 2013 included $0.9&nbsp;million and $1.1&nbsp;million, respectively, paid in aggregate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	27
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

</FONT>

<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	quarterly settlement payments pursuant to our interest rate hedges. The decrease in interest expense in 2014 resulted from decreased average outstanding debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Income tax expense increased to $6.6&nbsp;million in 2014 from $5.0&nbsp;million in 2013, an increase of $1.5&nbsp;million, or 30.2%. The increase in income tax expense in 2014 compared to 2013 was primarily due to the increase in our income before taxes. Our effective income tax rate for 2014 decreased slightly to 25.3% compared to our 2013 rate of 25.4%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Net income increased to $19.4&nbsp;million ($3.47 per share diluted) in 2014, compared to $14.8&nbsp;million ($2.66 per share diluted) in 2013, an increase of $4.6&nbsp;million, or 30.9%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	FINANCIAL CONDITION.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Capital Requirements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We require capital primarily for normal recurring capital and re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;equipping projects, modernization and expansion and development projects and acquisitions. Our capital needs are expected to be met principally from cash on hand, cash flows from operations and our $75&nbsp;million revolving credit facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect to spend approximately $8.0&nbsp;to $10.0&nbsp;million per year over the next several years in our Lime and Limestone Operations for normal recurring capital and re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;equipping projects at our plants and facilities to maintain or improve efficiency, ensure compliance with Environmental Laws, meet customer needs and reduce costs. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had approximately $0.8 million in open orders or contractual commitments for our Lime and Limestone Operations and none for our Natural Gas Interests.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Net cash provided by operations was $32.5&nbsp;million in 2015, compared to $32.0&nbsp;million in 2014, an increase of $0.5&nbsp;million, or 1.6%. Our net cash provided by operating activities is composed of net income, depreciation, depletion and amortization (&#x201C;DD&amp;A&#x201D;), other non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cash items included in net income and changes in working capital. In 2015, net cash provided by operating activities was principally composed of $12.9&nbsp;million net income, $16.0&nbsp;million DD&amp;A, $1.2&nbsp;million stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation and $2.5&nbsp;million increase from changes in operating assets and liabilities. The increase in net cash provided by operations in 2015 compared to 2014 was primarily the result of a $1.5&nbsp;million decrease in trade receivables, net, compared to a $3.3 million increase in 2014, a $0.7 decrease in prepaid expenses and other current assets in 2015, compared to a $0.9 million increase in 2014, a $1.1 million increase in DD&amp;A in 2015 compared to 2014 and a $0.2&nbsp;million increase in accounts payable and accrued expenses in 2015, compared to a $1.0&nbsp;million decrease in 2014. These changes were partially offset by the $6.5&nbsp;million decrease in net income in 2015 and a $1.3 million increase in inventories in 2015, compared to a $0.3 million decrease in 2014. The decrease in trade receivables, net in 2015 resulted from the $4.1 million decrease in revenues in the fourth quarter 2015 compared to the fourth quarter 2014, while the increase in trade receivables, net in 2014 resulted from the $5.3&nbsp;million increase in revenues in the fourth quarter 2014 compared to the fourth quarter 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Net cash used in investing activities was $11.1&nbsp;million for 2015 compared to $15.1&nbsp;million in 2014, primarily for normal recurring capital and re
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;equipping projects at our plants and facilities, other than $3.7&nbsp;million paid at closing in 2014 for the acquisition of the assets of a trucking company operation in Houston, Texas. Net cash used in financing activities primarily consisted of $16.7 and $5.0&nbsp;million to repay term loans in 2015 and 2014, respectively, $2.8&nbsp;million for dividend payments in each of 2015 and 2014 and $0.4 and $0.3&nbsp;million to repurchase shares of our common stock in 2015 and 2014, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;Such share repurchases included $0.2 million in 2015 repurchases pursuant to the Company&#x2019;s publicly announced $10 million share repurchase program, leaving up to $9.8 million for such repurchases in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our cash and cash equivalents at December&nbsp;31, 2015 increased to $59.9&nbsp;million from $58.3&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2016, through March 3, 2016, we have spent $2.7 million to repurchase shares pursuant to our $10 million share repurchase program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Banking Facilities and Other Debt.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp; &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On May 7, 2015, we amended our credit agreement with Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. (the &#x201C;Lender&#x201D;) to, among other things, provide for a $75 million revolving credit facility (the &#x201C;New Revolving Facility&#x201D;) and reduced interest rate margins and commitment fees (the &#x201C;Amendment&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Amendment also provides for an incremental four-year accordion feature to borrow up to an additional $50 million on the same terms, subject to approval by the Lender or another lender selected by us.&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms of the Amendment provide for a final
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

	28
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	maturity of the New Revolving Facility and any incremental loan on May 7, 2020; interest rates, at our option, of LIBOR plus a margin of 1.000% (previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.750%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to 2.000% (previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.750%),
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or the Lender&#x2019;s Prime Rate plus a margin of 0.000% to plus 1.000%; and a commitment fee range of 0.200% (previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.250%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to 0.350% (previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.400%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the undrawn portion of the New Revolving Facility.&nbsp;&nbsp;The New Revolving Facility interest rate margins and commitment fee are determined quarterly in accordance with a pricing grid based upon the Company&#x2019;s Cash Flow Leverage Ratio, defined as the ratio of the Company&#x2019;s total funded senior indebtedness to earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, depletion, amortization and stock-based compensation expense (&#x201C;EBITDA&#x201D;) for the 12 months ended on the last day of the most recent calendar quarter, plus pro forma EBITDA from any businesses acquired during the period.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to a security agreement, dated August 25, 2004, the New Revolving Facility is secured by the Company&#x2019;s existing and hereafter acquired tangible assets, intangible assets and real property.&nbsp;&nbsp;The maturity of the New Revolving Facility and any incremental loans can be accelerated if any event of default, as defined under the credit agreement, occurs.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our maximum Cash Flow Leverage Ratio is 3.50 to 1 (previously 3.25 to 1).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We may pay dividends so long as we remain in compliance with the provisions of our credit agreement, and may purchase, redeem or otherwise acquire shares of our common stock so long as our pro forma Cash Flow Leverage Ratio is less than 3.00 to 1.00 and no default or event of default exists or would exist after giving effect to such stock repurchase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Prior to t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he Amendment, our credit agreement included a ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year $40&nbsp;million term loan (the &#x201C;Term Loan&#x201D;), a ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year $20&nbsp;million multiple draw term loan (the &#x201C;Draw Term Loan&#x201D;) and a $30&nbsp;million revolving credit facility (the &#x201C;Revolving Facility&#x201D;) (collectively, the &#x201C;Credit Facilities&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;The Term Loan required quarterly principal payments of $0.8 million, with a final principal payment of $7.5&nbsp;million due on December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Draw Term Loan required quarterly principal payments of $0.4 million, with a final principal payment of $5.4&nbsp;million due on December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Revolving Facility was scheduled to mature on June&nbsp;1, 2015. The maturity of the Term Loan, the Draw Term Loan and the Revolving Facility could have been accelerated if any event of default, as defined under the Credit Facilities, occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We had interest rate hedges, with the Lender as the counterparty to the hedges that fixed LIBOR through maturity at 4.695%, 4.875% and 5.500% on the outstanding balance of the Term Loan, 75% of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan and 25% of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan, respectively. Based on our LIBOR margin of 1.750% prior to the Amendment, our interest rates had been: 6.445% on the outstanding balance of the Term Loan; 6.625% on 75% of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan; and 7.250% on 25% of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The hedges had been effective as defined under applicable accounting rules. Therefore, changes in fair value of the interest rate hedges were reflected in comprehensive income. We would have been exposed to credit losses in the event of non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;performance by the counterparty to the hedges. Due to interest rate declines, the mark to market of our interest rate hedges, at December 31, 2014, resulted in liability of $0.7&nbsp;million, which was included in accrued expenses on our Consolidated Balance Sheets. We paid $0.2 and $0.9&nbsp;million in aggregate quarterly settlement payments pursuant to the hedges in 2015 and 2014, respectively. These payments were included in interest expense in our Consolidated Statements of Income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On May 7, 2015, we paid off the $15.4 million balance then outstanding on the Term Loan and Draw Term Loan, as well as paid $0.5 million to repurchase the related hedges, from cash on hand.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cost to repurchase the hedges was included in interest expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We had $0.7&nbsp;million of letters of credit issued under the Revolving Facility as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, which count as draws against the available commitment under the New Revolving Facility, but no cash draws.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Capital Expenditures.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We have made a substantial amount of capital investments over the past several years to modernize our plants and facilities and expand our lime and limestone operations, and to fund the drilling and completion of 40 natural gas wells.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Capital expenditure activities totaled $11.5 and $15.4&nbsp;million, in 2015 and 2014, respectively. Activities in 2014 included $3.7&nbsp;million for the acquisition of the assets of a trucking company operation in Houston, Texas (with $50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	thousand deferred and paid in 2015 and another $50 thousand deferred to be paid in 2016), including $1.7&nbsp;million for land and buildings and $2.1&nbsp;million for trucks, trailers and other equipment. Prior to the purchase, the trucking company exclusively delivered the Company&#x2019;s products to its customers and slurry facilities, and the land purchased included the site leased for our slurry facility. We utilize the acquired assets to deliver our products to our customers and facilities and do not haul for third parties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Common Stock Buybacks.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We spent $0.4, $0.3 and $0.2&nbsp;million in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, to repurchase treasury shares.&nbsp;&nbsp;Included in the 2015 expenditures is $0.2 spent as part of our publicly announced share repurchase program commenced in December 2015 to repurchase up to $10 million of our common stock.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had $0.7&nbsp;million of letters of credit outstanding and no other draws on our New Revolving Facility. We believe that cash on hand and cash flows from operations will be sufficient to meet our operating needs, ongoing capital needs, including our possible modernization and expansion and development projects, and liquidity needs and allow us to continue to repurchase our common stock under our publicly announced share repurchase program as well as pay cash dividends for the near future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#8209;Balance Sheet Arrangements.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;We do not utilize off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;balance sheet financing arrangements; however, we lease railcars, corporate office space and some equipment used in our operations under operating lease agreements that are either non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;cancelable or subject to significant penalty upon cancellation, and have various limestone mineral leases. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the total future lease payments under our various operating and mineral leases totaled $5.0&nbsp;million and $1.7&nbsp;million, respectively, and are due in payments as summarized in the table above.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ITEM 7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DISCLOSURES
</FONT>
<A NAME="USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEM7AQUANTITATIVEANDQUALITATIVEDISCLOSU">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	ABOUT MARKET RISK.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	INTEREST RATE RISK.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ould be exposed to changes in interest rates, primarily as a result of floating interest rates on the New Revolving Facility.&nbsp;&nbsp;There was no outstanding balance on the New Revolving Facility subject to interest rate risk at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Any future borrowings under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	New
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revolving Facility would be subject to interest rate risk. See Note&nbsp;3 of Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPOR
</FONT>
<A NAME="USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_REPORT_442590">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	T OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Board of Directors and Shareholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals,&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of United States Lime &amp; Minerals, Inc. and Subsidiaries (the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;) as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, stockholders&#x2019; equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#x2019;s management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these financial statements based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement. An audit includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the financial statements. An audit also includes assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of United States Lime &amp; Minerals, Inc. and Subsidiaries as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, and the results of their operations and their cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2015 in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As discussed in Note 2 to the consolidated financial statements, the Company adopted new accounting guidance in 2015 and 2014, related to the presentation of deferred income taxes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2015, based on criteria established in the 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO), and our report dated March 4, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
