<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Board of Directors and Shareholders
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals,&nbsp;Inc. and Subsidiaries
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have audited the internal control over financial reporting of United States Lime &amp; Minerals, Inc. and Subsidiaries (the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;) as of December 31, 2015, based on criteria established in the 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). The Company&#x2019;s management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included in the accompanying Management&#x2019;s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the Company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	A company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company&#x2019;s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company&#x2019;s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In our opinion, the Company maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2015, based on criteria established in the 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Internal Control&#x2014;Integrated Framework
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issued by COSO.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated financial statements of the Company as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, and our report dated March 4, 2016 expressed an unqualified opinion on those financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:50.00%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT 4.3PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:50.00%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT 4.3PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(dollars in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Summary
</FONT>
<A NAME="USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_NOTES">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Significant Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Organization
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals, Inc. (the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;) is a manufacturer of lime and limestone products,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	supplying primarily the construction (including highway, road and building contractors), environmental (including municipal sanitation and water treatment facilities and flue gas treatment processes), industrial (including paper and glass manufacturers), metals (including steel producers), roof shingle, oil and gas services and agriculture (including poultry and cattle feed producers) industries
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The Company is headquartered in Dallas, Texas and operates lime and limestone plants and distribution facilities in Arkansas, Colorado, Louisiana, Oklahoma and Texas through its wholly owned subsidiaries, Arkansas Lime Company, Colorado Lime Company, Texas Lime Company, U.S. Lime Company, U.S. Lime Company &#x2013; Shreveport, U.S. Lime Company &#x2013; St.&nbsp;Clair and U.S. Lime Company &#x2013; Transportation. In addition, the Company, through its wholly owned subsidiary, U.S. Lime Company - O&nbsp;&amp; G, LLC, has royalty and non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;operating working interests in natural gas wells located in Johnson County, Texas, in the Barnett Shale Formation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Principles of Consolidation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company and its subsidiaries. All intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(c)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Use of Estimates
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The preparation of financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (&#x201C;US&nbsp;GAAP&#x201D;) requires management to make estimates and judgments that affect the amounts reported in the financial statements and accompanying notes. Actual results could differ from those estimates and judgments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(d)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Statements of Cash Flows
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For purposes of reporting cash flows, the Company considers all certificates of deposit and highly
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;liquid debt instruments, such as U.S. Treasury bills and notes, with maturities, at the time of purchase, of three months or less to be cash equivalents. Cash equivalents are carried at cost plus accrued interest, which approximates fair market value. Supplemental cash flow information is presented below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(e)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes revenue for its lime and limestone operations in accordance with the terms of its purchase orders, contracts or purchase agreements, which are generally upon shipment, and when payment is considered probable. Revenues include external freight billed to customers with related costs in cost of revenues. The Company&#x2019;s returns and allowances are minimal. External freight billed to customers included in revenues was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$23,219,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$27,055
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$25,536
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, which approximates the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	39
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(dollars in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 201

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	amount of external freight billed to customers included in cost of revenues. Sales taxes billed to customers are not included in revenues. For its natural gas interests, the Company recognizes revenue in the month of production and delivery.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(f)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Fair Values of Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Fair value is defined as &#x201C;the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.&#x201D; The Company uses a three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;tier fair value hierarchy, which classifies the inputs used in measuring fair values, in determining the fair value of its financial assets and liabilities. These tiers include: Level&nbsp;1, defined as observable inputs such as quoted prices for identical instruments in active markets; Level&nbsp;2, defined as observable inputs other than Level&nbsp;1 prices such as quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices in markets that are not active, or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities; and Level&nbsp;3, defined as unobservable inputs in which little or no market data exists, therefore requiring an entity to develop its own assumptions. Specific inputs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that had been
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	used to value the Company&#x2019;s interest rate swap liabilities included quoted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three-month LIBOR
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rates for the remaining life of the interest rate swaps. There were no changes in the methods and assumptions used in measuring fair value during the period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The carrying values of cash and cash equivalents, trade receivables, other current assets, accounts payable and accrued expenses approximate fair value due to the short maturity of these instruments.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Prior to their repurchase, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he Company&#x2019;s interest rate hedges
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	wer
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e carried at fair value at December&nbsp;31
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014. See Notes&nbsp;1(p), 3 and 4. Financial liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis are summarized below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:10PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(g)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Concentration of Credit Risk and Trade Receivables
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Financial instruments that potentially subject the Company to a concentration of credit risk consist principally of cash and cash equivalents, trade receivables and derivative financial instruments. The Company places its cash and cash equivalents with high credit quality financial institutions and its derivative financial instruments with financial institutions and other firms that management believes have high credit ratings. The Company&#x2019;s cash and cash equivalents at commercial banking institutions normally exceed federally insured limits. For a discussion of the credit risks associated with the Company&#x2019;s derivative financial instruments, see Note&nbsp;3.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The majority of the Company&#x2019;s trade receivables are unsecured. Payment terms for all trade receivables are based on the underlying purchase orders, contracts or purchase agreements. Credit losses relating to trade receivables have generally been within management expectations and historical trends. Uncollected trade receivables are charged
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;off when identified by management to be unrecoverable. Trade receivables are presented net of the related allowance for doubtful accounts, which totaled $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	40
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0 and $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	350
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at December&nbsp;31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	40
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(h)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Inventories, Net
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Inventories are valued principally at the lower of cost, determined using the average cost method, or market. Costs for raw materials and finished goods include materials, labor and production overhead. A summary of inventories is as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For major constructed assets, the capitalized cost includes the price paid by the Company for labor and materials plus interest and internal and external project management costs that are directly related to the constructed assets. Machinery and equipment at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014 included
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$4,113
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3,157
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively, of construction in progress for various capital projects.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	No
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	interest costs were capitalized for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. Depreciation of property, plant and equipment is being provided for by the straight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;line method over estimated useful lives as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:02.62%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

	years

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.92%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;PADDING:0PT;">

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 1PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Maintenance and repairs are charged to expense as incurred; renewals and betterments are capitalized. When units of property are retired or otherwise disposed of, their cost and related accumulated depreciation are removed from the accounts, and any resulting gain or loss is credited or charged to income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company expenses all exploration costs as incurred as well as costs incurred at an operating quarry or mine, other than capital expenditures and inventory. Costs to acquire mineral reserves or mineral interests are capitalized upon acquisition. Development costs incurred to develop new mineral reserves, to expand the capacity of a quarry or mine, or to develop quarry or mine areas substantially in advance of current production are capitalized once proven and probable reserves exist and can be economically produced. For each quarry or mine, capitalized costs to acquire and develop mineral reserves are depleted using the units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;production method based on the proven and probable reserves for such quarry or mine.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	41
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(dollars in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company reviews its long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;lived assets for impairment and, when events or circumstances indicate the carrying amount of an asset may not be recoverable, the Company determines if impairment of value exists. If the estimated undiscounted future net cash flows are less than the carrying amount of the asset, an impairment exists, and an impairment loss must be calculated and recorded. If an impairment exists, the impairment loss is calculated based on the excess of the carrying amount of the asset over the asset&#x2019;s fair value. Any impairment loss is treated as a permanent reduction in the carrying value of the asset. Through December 31, 2015, no events or circumstances arose that would require the Company to record a provision for impairment of its long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;lived assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(j)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Successful
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Efforts Method Used for Natural Gas Interests
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company uses the successful
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;efforts method to account for oil and gas exploration and development expenditures. Under this method, drilling, completion and workover costs for successful exploratory wells and all development well costs are capitalized and depleted using the units
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;production method. Costs to drill exploratory wells that do not find proved reserves are expensed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(k)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Asset Retirement Obligations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company recognizes legal obligations for reclamation and remediation associated with the retirement of long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;lived assets at their fair value at the time the obligations are incurred (&#x201C;AROs&#x201D;). Over time, the liability for AROs is recorded at its present value each period through accretion expense, and the capitalized cost is depreciated over the useful life of the related asset. Upon settlement of the liability, the Company either settles the AROs for the recorded amount or recognizes a gain or loss. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company&#x2019;s AROs included in other liabilities and accrued expenses were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$2,058
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$1,261
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$1,041
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of assets associated with the Company&#x2019;s AROs are not fully depreciated. During 2015 and 2014, the Company spent
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$140
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$113
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on its AROs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and recognized accretion expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$60
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$57
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$61
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2015, 2014 and 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	respectively, on its AROs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The AROs were estimated based on studies and the Company&#x2019;s process knowledge and estimates, and are discounted using a credit adjusted risk-free interest rate. The AROs are adjusted when further information warrants an adjustment. The Company estimates annual expenditures of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$100
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$200
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	each in years 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	through 20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	20
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	relating to its AROs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(l)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Other Assets

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Other assets consist of the following:

<P STYLE="MARGIN:10PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(m)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Environmental Expenditures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Environmental expenditures that relate to current operations are expensed or capitalized as appropriate. Expenditures that relate to an existing condition caused by past operations, and which do not contribute to current or future revenue generation, are expensed. Liabilities are recorded at their present value when environmental assessments and/or remedial efforts are probable and the costs can be reasonably estimated.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 80.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:62.22%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.96%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">

	2.66

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:12PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="WIDTH: 46.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	(1)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:4PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:4PT;WIDTH:4PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Excludes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	24,225
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	7,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	15,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	stock options in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively, as antidilutive because the exercise price exceeded the average per share market price for the periods presented.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(o)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Based Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company expenses all stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based payments to employees and directors, including grants of stock options and restricted stock, in the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Statements of Income based on their fair values. Compensation cost is recognized
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on a straight-line basis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	over the vesting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(p)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Every derivative instrument (including certain derivative instruments embedded
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in other contracts) wa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s recorded on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets as either an asset or liability measured at its fair value. Changes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in the derivative&#x2019;s fair value we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	re recognized currently in earnings unless specific hedge accounting criteria
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	re met. If the derivative
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	wa
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s designated as a cash flow hedge, changes in fair value
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	re recognized in comprehensiv
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e income until the hedged item was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	recognized in earnings.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company estimate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	fair value utilizing the cash flows valuation technique. The fair values of derivative contracts that expire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	d in less than one year we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	re recognized as current assets or liabilities. Those that expire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	d
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in more than one year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	re recognized as long-term assets or liabilities. See Notes 1(f), 3 and 4.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(q)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company utilizes the asset and liability approach in its reporting for income taxes. Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are computed for differences between the financial statement and tax bases of assets and liabilities that will result in taxable or deductible amounts in the future based on enacted tax laws and rates applicable to the periods in which the differences are expected to affect taxable income. Valuation allowances
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	43
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(dollars in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are established when necessary to reduce deferred tax assets to the amount more likely than not to be realized. Income tax related interest and penalties are included in income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company also assesses individual tax positions to determine if they meet the criteria for some or all of the benefits of that position to be recognized in the Company&#x2019;s financial statements. The Company only recognizes tax positions that meet the more
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;likely
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;not recognition threshold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;TEXT-INDENT: -36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(r)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Comprehensive Income
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT 36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Accounting principles generally require that recognized revenue, expenses, gains and losses be included in net income. Certain changes in assets and liabilities, such as mark
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;market gains or losses of interest rate hedges
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and minimum pension liability adjustments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, are reported as a separate component of the stockholders&#x2019; equity section of the balance sheet. Such items, along with net income, are components of comprehensive income. See Notes&nbsp;1(p), 3, 4 and 6.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(2)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	New Accounting Pronouncements
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In May 2014, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (the &#x201C;FASB&#x201D;) issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-09 (&#x201C;ASU 2014-09&#x201D;), &#x201C;Revenue from Contracts with Customers,&#x201D; which stipulates that an entity should recognize revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services.&nbsp;&nbsp;To achieve this core principle, an entity should apply the following steps: (1) identify the contract(s) with a customer; (2) identify the performance obligations in the contract(s); (3) determine the transaction price; (4) allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the contract(s); and (5) recognize revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies a performance obligation.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The new guidance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will be effective for the Company beginning January 1, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, with early adoption permitted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for annual periods beginning after December 15, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company is currently evaluating the impact of the adoption of ASU 2014-09 on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In August 2014, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2014-15 (&#x201C;ASU 2014-15&#x201D;), &#x201C;Disclosure of Uncertainties About an Entity&#x2019;s Ability to Continue as a Going Concern.&#x201D; ASU 2014-15 requires management to perform interim and annual assessments of an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern for a period of one year after the date the financial statements are issued and provides guidance on determining when and how to disclose going concern uncertainties in the financial statements. Certain disclosures will be required if conditions give rise to substantial doubt about an entity&#x2019;s ability to continue as a going concern. ASU 2014-15 applies to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ll entities and is effective
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the Company beginning January 1, 2017
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, with early adoption permitted. The Company does not expect that the adoption of this standard will have a material effect on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In August 2015, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2015-17 (&#x201C;ASU 2015-17&#x201D;), &#x201C;Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes,&#x201D; which no longer requires separate disclosure of current and noncurrent deferred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax assets and liabilities.&nbsp;&nbsp;ASU 2015-17 is effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2017, with early adoption permitted.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because the Company believes it simplifies the presentation of deferred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	taxes, it adopted ASU 2015-17 retrospectively in 2015.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$434
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of current deferred tax assets that were included in prepaid expenses and other current assets at December 31, 2014 have been reclassified to deferred tax liabilities, net on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(3)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Banking Facilities and Debt
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On May 7, 2015, the Company amended its credit agreement with Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. (the &#x201C;Lender&#x201D;) to, among other things, provide for a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$75,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	revolving credit facility (the &#x201C;New Revolving Facility&#x201D;) and reductions to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	44
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#USLM-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(dollars in thousands, except per share amounts)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	and 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	3
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	interest rate margins and commitment fees (the &#x201C;Amendment&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Amendment also provides for an incremental
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	four
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	-year accordion feature to borrow up to an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$50,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the same terms, subject to approval by the Lender or another lender selected by the Company.&nbsp;&nbsp;The terms of the Amendment provide for a final maturity of the New Revolving Facility and any incremental loan on May 7, 2020; interest rates, at the Company&#x2019;s option, of LIBOR plus a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.000%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.750%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.000%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2.750%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	or the Lender&#x2019;s Prime Rate plus a margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.000%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to plus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.000%;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and a commitment fee range of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.200%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.250%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.350%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.400%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;on the undrawn portion of the New Revolving Facility.&nbsp;&nbsp;The New Revolving Facility interest rate margins and commitment fee are determined quarterly in accordance with a pricing grid based upon the Company&#x2019;s Cash Flow Leverage Ratio, defined as the ratio of the Company&#x2019;s total funded senior indebtedness to earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, depletion, amortization and stock-based compensation expense (&#x201C;EBITDA&#x201D;) for the 12 months ended on the last day of the most recent calendar quarter, plus pro forma EBITDA from any businesses acquired during the period.&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to a security agreement, dated August 25, 2004, the New Revolving Facility is secured by the Company&#x2019;s existing and hereafter acquired tangible assets, intangible assets and real property.&nbsp;&nbsp;The maturity of the New Revolving Facility and any incremental loans can be accelerated if any event of default, as defined under the credit agreement, occurs.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company&#x2019;s maximum Cash Flow Leverage Ratio is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3.50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to 1 (previously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3.25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to 1).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	At December 31, 2015, the Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$710
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;of letters of credit issued, which count as draws against the available commitment under the New Revolving Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company may pay dividends so long as it remains in compliance with the provisions of the Company&#x2019;s credit agreement, and may purchase, redeem or otherwise acquire shares of its common stock so long as its pro forma Cash Flow Leverage Ratio is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to 1.00 and no default or event of default exists or would exist after giving effect to such stock repurchase.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Prior to t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he Amendment, the Company&#x2019;s credit agreement included a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$40,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;term loan (the &#x201C;Term Loan&#x201D;), a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$20,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;multiple draw term loan (the &#x201C;Draw Term Loan&#x201D;) and a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0,00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;revolving credit facility (the &#x201C;Revolving Facility&#x201D;) (collectively, the &#x201C;Credit Facilities&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;The Term Loan required quarterly principal payments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$833
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, with a final principal payment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$7,500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;due on December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Draw Term Loan required quarterly principal payments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$417
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, with a final principal payment of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$5,400
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;due on December&nbsp;31, 2015. The Revolving Facility was scheduled to mature on June&nbsp;1, 2015. The maturity of the Term Loan, the Draw Term Loan and the Revolving Facility could have been accelerated if any event of default, as defined under the Credit Facilities, occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company had interest rate hedges, with the Lender as the counterparty to the hedges that fixed LIBOR through maturity at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4.695%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4.875%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5.500%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the outstanding balance of the Term Loan,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan, respectively. Based on the current LIBOR margin of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.750%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	prior to the Amendment, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Company&#x2019;s interest rates had been:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6.445%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on the outstanding balance of the Term Loan;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6.625%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	75%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan; and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7.250%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	25%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of the outstanding balance of the Draw Term Loan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The hedges had been effective as defined under applicable accounting rules. Therefore, changes in fair value of the interest rate hedges were reflected in comprehensive income. The Company would have been exposed to credit losses in the event of non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;performance by the counterparty to the hedges. Due to interest rate declines, the Company&#x2019;s mark to market of its interest rate hedges, at December 31, 2014, resulted in liability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$661
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, which was included in accrued expenses on the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Balance Sheets. The Company paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$191
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$920
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;in aggregate quarterly settlement payments pursuant to the hedges in 2015 and 2014, respectively. These payments were included in interest expense in the Company&#x2019;s Consolidated Statements of Income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	On May 7, 2015, the Company paid off the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$15,400
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	balance then outstanding on the Term Loan and Draw Term Loan, as well as paid
</FONT>

	$500
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to repurchase the related hedges, from cash on hand.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cost to repurchase the hedges was included in interest expense.

</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Generally, US&nbsp;GAAP requires deferred tax assets to be reduced by a valuation allowance if, based on the weight of available evidence, it is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	more likely than not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	that some portion or all of the deferred tax assets will not be realized. US&nbsp;GAAP requires an assessment of all available evidence, both positive and negative, to determine the amount of any required valuation allowance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:9PT 0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	47
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:10.54%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
<DIV STYLE="FLOAT:LEFT">
</DIV>
	881
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:00.46%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	federal net operating loss carry forwards at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	At
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, the Company had determined that, because of its recent income history and expectations of income in the future, its deferred tax assets were fully realizable.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s federal income tax returns for the year ended December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and subsequent years remain subject to examination.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company&#x2019;s income tax returns in certain state income tax jurisdictions remain subject to examination for various periods for the year ended December 31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and subsequent years.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company treats interest and penalties on income tax liabilities as income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(6)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Employee Retirement Plans
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During the second quarter 2015, after receipt of a favorable determination letter from the Internal Revenue Service, the Company terminated a noncontributory defined benefit plan that, prior to the termination, covered substantially all of the union employees previously employed by its wholly owned subsidiary, Corson Lime Company (the &#x201C;Plan&#x201D;).&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 1997, the Company sold substantially all of the assets of Corson Lime Company, and all benefits for participants in the Plan were frozen. During 1997 and 1998, the Company made contributions to the Plan that were intended to fully fund the benefits earned by the participants. The unfunded projected benefit obligation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$275
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recorded comprehensive income of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$602
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, net of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$344
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	expense
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and comprehensive expense of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$81
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, net of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$46
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax benefit, and comprehensive income of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$197
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, net of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$112
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax expense, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company made contributions of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$233
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to the Plan in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As a result of the termination, t
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he Company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will not
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	be required to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	make a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ny further
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	contribution
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s to the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In the first quarter 2014, the Company, based on the underfunded status of the Plan being only
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at December 31, 2013, started the process of terminating the Plan, including requesting a determination letter from the Internal Revenue Service as to the qualified status of the Plan upon termination of the Plan.&nbsp;&nbsp;To that end, the administrative committee, consisting of management employees appointed by the Company&#x2019;s Board of Directors, consulted with the investment advisor for the Plan and reallocated the Plan&#x2019;s assets into stable assets consisting of cash and cash equivalents and short-term fixed income investments.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

	The weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average assumptions used in the measurement of the Plan benefit obligation at December&nbsp;31 are as follows:

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_31"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">

	The Company has
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	contributory retirement (401(k)) savings plans for non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;union employees and for union employees of Arkansas Lime Company and Texas Lime Company. Company contributions to these plans were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$174,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$184
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$156
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 10PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	(7)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	&#8209;Based Compensation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 9PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company has implemented the Amended and Restated 2001 Long
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;Term Incentive Plan (the &#x201C;2001 Plan&#x201D;). The 2001 Plan provides for stock options, restricted stock and dollar
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;denominated cash awards, including performance
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards. In addition to stock options, restricted stock and cash awards, the 2001 Plan provides for the grant of stock appreciation rights, deferred stock and other stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based awards to directors, officers, employees and consultants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 9PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The number of shares of common stock that may be subject to outstanding awards granted under the 2001 Plan (determined immediately after the grant of any award) may not exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	741,413
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from the inception of the 2001 Plan. In addition, no individual may receive awards in any one calendar year of more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	100,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shares of common stock. Stock options granted under the 2001 Plan expire
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years from the date of grant and generally become exercisable, or vest, immediately. Restricted stock generally vests over periods of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;half
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years. Upon the exercise of stock options, the Company issues common stock from its non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;issued authorized or treasury shares that have been reserved for issuance pursuant to the 2001 Plan. At December 31, 2015, the number of shares of common stock remaining available for future grants of stock options, restricted stock or other forms of stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based compensation under the 2001 Plan was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	126
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	912
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_33"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:50.70%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;HEIGHT:1.00PT;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;OVERFLOW: HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	There were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	non
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;vested stock options at December 31, 2015, and the weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average remaining contractual life of the outstanding and exercisable stock options at such date was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	6.46
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;years. The total compensation cost not yet recognized for restricted stock at December 31, 2015 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$929,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	which will be recognized over the weighted average of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.08
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The fair value for the stock options was estimated at the date of grant using a lattice
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;based option valuation model, with the following weighted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;average assumptions for the 2015, 2014 and 2013 grants: risk
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;free interest rates of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.98%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.28%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.05%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.89%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.17%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.10%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2014, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.34%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.77%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.65%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2013; a dividend yield of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.80%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.91%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.83%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.70%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.90%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.75%)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	; and a volatility factor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.272
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.284
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>

	.275
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	) in 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.294
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.316
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.299)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2014, and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.304
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.307
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(weighted average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.306)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2013, based on the monthly per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;share closing prices for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years preceding the date of issuance. In addition, the fair value of these options was estimated based on an expected life of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	years. The fair value of restricted stock is based on the closing per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;share price of the Company&#x2019;s common stock on the date of grant.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
