<A NAME="eolPage75"></A>
<A NAME="USLM-20151231EX991968D4A_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_99>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_99"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A NAME="USLM-20151231EX991968D4A_HTM__GOBACK">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	EXHIBIT 99.1
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	January&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5429 LBJ Freeway
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Suite&nbsp;230
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Dallas, Texas 75240
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Ladies and Gentlemen:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Pursuant to your request, we have prepared estimates of the extent and value of the net proved condensate, natural gas liquids (NGL), and natural gas reserves, as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, of certain selected properties that United States Lime&nbsp;&amp; Minerals,&nbsp;Inc. (US Lime) has represented that it owns. US Lime has represented that these properties account for 100&nbsp;percent on a million cubic feet net equivalent basis of US Lime
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s net proved
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	reserves as of December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The reserves are located in the Newark East field in Johnson County, Texas. The net proved reserves estimates prepared by us have been prepared in accordance with the reserves definitions of Rules&nbsp;4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;10(a)(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;(32) of Regulation&nbsp;S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;X of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) of the United States. This report was prepared in accordance with guidelines specified in Item&nbsp;1202(a)(8) of Regulation&nbsp;S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;K and is to be used for inclusion in certain SEC filings by US Lime.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Reserves estimates included herein are expressed as net reserves. Gross reserves are defined as the total estimated petroleum to be produced from these properties after December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Net reserves are defined as that portion of the gross reserves attributable to the interests owned by US Lime after deducting all interests owned by others.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Data used in this evaluation were obtained from reviews with US Lime personnel, from US Lime files, from records on file with the appropriate regulatory agencies, and from public sources. In the preparation of this report we have relied, without independent verification, upon such information furnished by US Lime with respect to property interests, production from such properties, current costs of operation and development, current prices for production, agreements relating to current and future operations and sale of production, and various other information and data that were accepted as represented. A field examination of the properties was not considered necessary for the purposes of this report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Definition of Reserves
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Petroleum reserves estimated by us included in this report are classified as proved. Only proved reserves have been evaluated for this report. Reserves classifications used by us in this report are in accordance with the reserves definitions of Rules&nbsp;4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;10(a)(1)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;(32) of Regulation&nbsp;S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;X of the SEC. Reserves are judged to be economically producible in future years from known reservoirs under existing economic and operating conditions and assuming continuation of current regulatory practices using conventional production methods and equipment. In the analyses of production
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;decline curves, reserves were estimated only to the limit of economic rates of production under existing economic and operating conditions using prices and costs consistent with the effective date of this report, including consideration of changes in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage76"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	existing prices provided only by contractual arrangements but not including escalations based upon future conditions. The petroleum reserves are classified as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Proved oil and gas reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Proved oil and gas reserves are those quantities of oil and gas, which, by analysis of geoscience and engineering data, can be estimated with reasonable certainty to be economically producible
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from a given date forward, from known reservoirs, and under existing economic conditions, operating methods, and government regulations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	prior to the time at which contracts providing the right to operate expire, unless evidence indicates that renewal is reasonably certain, regardless of whether deterministic or probabilistic methods are used for the estimation. The project to extract the hydrocarbons must have commenced or the operator must be reasonably certain that it will commence the project within a reasonable time.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 26PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The area of the reservoir considered as proved includes:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:108PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:108PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 23PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	The area identified by drilling and limited by fluid contacts, if any, and (B)&nbsp;Adjacent undrilled portions of the reservoir that can, with reasonable certainty, be judged to be continuous with it and to contain economically producible oil or gas on the basis of available geoscience and engineering data.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	In the absence of data on fluid contacts, proved quantities in a reservoir are limited by the lowest known hydrocarbons (LKH) as seen in a well penetration unless geoscience, engineering, or performance data and reliable technology establishes a lower contact with reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 23PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Where direct observation from well penetrations has defined a highest known oil (HKO) elevation and the potential exists for an associated gas cap, proved oil reserves may be assigned in the structurally higher portions of the reservoir only if geoscience, engineering, or performance data and reliable technology establish the higher contact with reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 22PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Reserves which can be produced economically through application of improved recovery techniques (including, but not limited to, fluid injection) are included in the proved classification when:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:108PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:108PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 23PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(A)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Successful testing by a pilot project in an area of the reservoir with properties no more favorable than in the reservoir as a whole, the operation of an installed program in the reservoir or an analogous reservoir, or other evidence using reliable technology establishes the reasonable certainty of the engineering analysis on which the project or program was based; and (B)&nbsp;The project has been approved for development by all necessary parties and entities, including governmental entities.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 24PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Existing economic conditions include prices and costs at which economic producibility from a reservoir is to be determined. The price shall be the average price during the 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;month period prior to the ending date of the period covered by the report, determined as an un
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;weighted arithmetic average of the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;day
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;month price for each month within such period, unless prices are defined by contractual arrangements, excluding escalations based upon future conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Developed oil and gas reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Developed oil and gas reserves are reserves of any category that can be expected to be recovered:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 26PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Through existing wells with existing equipment and operating methods or in which the cost of the required equipment is relatively minor compared to the cost of a new well; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Through installed extraction equipment and infrastructure operational at the time of the reserves estimate if the extraction is by means not involving a well.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage77"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Undeveloped oil and gas reserves
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2014;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Undeveloped oil and gas reserves are reserves of any category that are expected to be recovered from new wells on undrilled acreage, or from existing wells where a relatively major expenditure is required for recompletion.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 26PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Reserves on undrilled acreage shall be limited to those directly offsetting development spacing areas that are reasonably certain of production when drilled, unless evidence using reliable technology exists that establishes reasonable certainty of economic producibility at greater distances.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 25PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Undrilled locations can be classified as having undeveloped reserves only if a development plan has been adopted indicating that they are scheduled to be drilled within five years, unless the specific circumstances justify a longer time.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:72PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%;TEXT-INDENT:36PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;;PADDING:0PT 23PT 0PT 0PT;">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Under no circumstances shall estimates for undeveloped reserves be attributable to any acreage for which an application of fluid injection or other improved recovery technique is contemplated, unless such techniques have been proved effective by actual projects in the same reservoir or an analogous reservoir, as defined in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	[
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	section&nbsp;210.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	&#8209;10(a) Definitions
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	]
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	, or by other evidence using reliable technology establishing reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Methodology and Procedures
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Estimates of reserves were prepared by the use of appropriate geologic, petroleum engineering, and evaluation principles and techniques that are in accordance with practices generally recognized by the petroleum industry as presented in the publication of the Society of Petroleum Engineers entitled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Standards Pertaining to the Estimating and Auditing of Oil and Gas Reserves Information (Revision as of February&nbsp;19, 2007).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The method or combination of methods used in the analysis of each reservoir was tempered by experience with similar reservoirs, stage of development, quality and completeness of basic data, and production history.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The properties evaluated in this report produce from the Barnett Shale. The Barnett Shale has low porosity and permeability. Gas production from this depletion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;drive reservoir is a function of both the natural fractures and the hydraulically induced fractures. The production
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;decline curves for the Barnett Shale wells in Johnson County, Texas, were analyzed to determine the shape and final decline of a typical well producing from this reservoir in the various areas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Based on the current stage of field development, production performance, the development plans provided by US Lime, and the analyses of areas offsetting existing wells with test or production data, reserves were classified as proved.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Proved developed producing reserves were estimated by extrapolation of historical production trends using a hyperbolic curve with a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;percent exponential tail that was terminated at an economic limit based on existing economic conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Proved undeveloped reserves were not estimated for any wells due to uncertainty regarding timing of development.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In certain cases, when the previously named methods could not be used, reserves were estimated by analogy with similar wells or reservoirs for which more complete data were available.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gas quantities estimated herein are expressed as sales gas. Wet gas is the indigenous gas in the reservoir to be produced. Sales gas is defined as that portion of the wet gas to be delivered into a gas pipeline for sale after separation, processing, fuel use, and flare. The net gas reserves are reported as sales gas. Gas quantities are expressed at a temperature base of 60 degrees Fahrenheit and at a pressure base of 14.65 pounds per square inch absolute, the legal pressure base of the state of Texas. Condensate reserves estimated herein are those to be recovered by conventional lease separation. NGL reserves were estimated using the typical yields received after the gas began to be processed for NGL.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage78"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The development status shown herein represents the status applicable on December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. In the preparation of this report, data available from wells drilled on the appraised properties through December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, were used in estimating gross ultimate recovery. When applicable, gross production estimated to December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, was deducted from gross ultimate recovery to arrive at the estimates of gross reserves as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Production data through November 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were available for all properties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 10PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our estimates of US Lime
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s net proved reserves attributable to the reviewed properties are based on the definitions of reserves of the SEC and are as follows, expressed in thousands of barrels (Mbbl) and millions of cubic feet (MMcf):
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_42"></A>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.52%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:07.10%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.52%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:07.10%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
	&nbsp;

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Primary Economic Assumptions
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenue values in this report are expressed in terms of estimated future gross revenue, future net revenue, and present worth of future net revenue. These values are based on the continuation of prices consistent with SEC guidelines in effect on December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Future gross revenue is defined as that revenue to be realized from the production and sale of the estimated net reserves. Future net revenue is calculated by deducting estimated production taxes, ad valorem taxes, operating, gathering, processing expenses, and capital costs from the future gross revenue. Present worth of future net revenue is calculated by discounting the future net revenue at the arbitrary rate of 10&nbsp;percent per year compounded monthly over the expected period of realization.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Present worth should not be construed as fair market value because no consideration was given to additional factors that influence the prices at which properties are bought and sold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Revenue values in this report were estimated using the initial prices and expenses provided by US Lime. Future prices were estimated using guidelines established by the SEC and the Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB). The prices used in this report are based on SEC guidelines. The assumptions used for estimating future prices and expenses are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	NGL and Condensate Prices
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 72PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	NGL and condensate price differentials for each property were based on information provided by US Lime. The West Texas Intermediate (WTI) price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is the 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month average price, calculated as the unweighted arithmetic average of the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;day
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month price for each month within the 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month period prior to the end of the reporting period. NGL prices were calculated for each property using the differentials to a WTI price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per barrel and held constant for the lives of the properties. The volume
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;weighted average NGL price over the lives of the properties was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	14
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	92
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per barrel. Condensate prices were calculated using these differentials to a WTI price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	50.16
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per barrel and held constant thereafter. The volume
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;weighted average condensate price of the proved reserves over the lives of the properties was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	47
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	15
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per barrel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Natural Gas Prices
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 72PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Gas prices were calculated for each property using the calculated differentials to a Henry Hub price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	64
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per million British thermal units (MMBtu). No escalation was applied to prices. The Henry Hub price of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	64
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is the 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month average price, calculated as the unweighted arithmetic average of the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;day
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month price for each month within the 12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;month period prior to the end of the reporting period. The volume
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;weighted average price of the proved reserves over the lives of the properties was $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	80
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per thousand cubic feet.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 54PT;TEXT-INDENT: -18PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Operating Expenses and Capital Costs
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT 72PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Operating expenses and abandonment costs, based on information provided by US Lime, were used in estimating future costs required to operate the properties. In certain cases, future costs, either higher or lower than existing costs, may have been used because of anticipated changes in operating conditions. These costs were not escalated for inflation.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;No additional capital costs were expected.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The estimated future revenue and expenditures attributable to the production and sale of US Lime
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s net proved reserves of the properties appraised, as of December&nbsp;31, 201
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, is summarized in thousands of dollars (M$) as follows:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Note:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Future income taxes have not been taken into account in the preparation of these estimates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Estimates of condensate, NGL, and natural gas reserves and future net revenue should be regarded only as estimates that may change as further production history and additional information become available. Not only are such reserves and revenue estimates based on that information which is currently available, but such estimates are also subject to the uncertainties inherent in the application of judgmental factors in interpreting such information.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	While the oil and gas industry may be subject to regulatory changes from time to time that could affect an industry participant
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x2019;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s ability to recover its condensate and gas reserves, we are not aware of any such governmental actions which would restrict the r
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ecovery of the December&nbsp;31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, estimated condensate, NGL, and gas reserves.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To the extent the above
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;enumerated rules, regulations, and statements require determinations of an accounting or legal nature, we, as engineers, are necessarily unable to express an opinion as to whether the above
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;described information is in accordance therewith or sufficient therefor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 12PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;LINE-HEIGHT:100%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	DeGolyer and MacNaughton is an independent petroleum engineering consulting firm that has been providing petroleum consulting services throughout the world since 1936. DeGolyer and MacNaughton does not have any financial interest, including stock ownership, in US Lime. Our fees were not contingent on the results of our evaluation. This letter report has been prepared at the request of US Lime. DeGolyer and MacNaughton has used all assumptions, data, procedures, and methods that it considers necessary and appropriate to prepare this report.
</FONT>
</P>
